CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Sherry, 4326 Lydia Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �I don�t ride the trolleys, and therefore have not given serious consideration to the proposed raise. However, I think that it is too high now.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Sherry, wearing collared flecked coat with lapels, and striped necktie, standing in front of light colored marble wall, left store window displaying toys including Popeye cartoon kit, dress designer kit, and bank-o-matic, right store window displaying female undergarments
